abstracts.cdata!:
The First Telecommunications Project
            will help expand and rehabilitate telecommunications
            facilities and assist the Instituto Ecuatoriano de
            Telecomunicaciones'(IETEL) institutional development.
            Funds will be directed to: (i) expand local telephone
            services to connect 189,000 additional subscribers; (ii)
            rehabilitate the existing network to improve service to
            about 50,000 existing subscribers; (iii) expand the long
            distance network; (iv) install 76 exchanges in rural areas;
            and (v) expand and modernize international telephone, telex
            and data service. The project will assist IETEL's
            institutional development by helping finance: (i) an
            agreement for technical cooperation or "twinning"
            between IETEL and a more developed telecommunications
            administration; (ii) a management development program for
            IETEL staff; and (iii) technical assistance to help
            strengthen IETEL's project implementation capacity.
